definition: to emit/to give off/to send out (or up, forth)/to brave/to face/reckless/to falsely adopt (sb's identity etc)/to feign/(literary) to cover

sentences.english: Daredevil couple decided to vacation far out.
sentences.chinese: 冒失鬼夫妇决定远出旅游度假。

sentences.english: In other words: one must not inconsiderately pester the cause of desire.
sentences.chinese: 换句话说，我们一定不要冒失地骚扰这个欲望的原因。

sentences.english: Not obtrusive, go up pertly courtship, you can refuse for certain.
sentences.chinese: 不要莽撞，冒冒失失上去求爱，你肯定会遭拒绝。

sentences.english: You got me trippin, stumbling, flippin, fumbling.
sentences.chinese: 你令我支吾，结巴，冒失，犯错，笨拙。

sentences.english: That little girl is very forward.
He rashly look the business in hand,and regretted shortly afterwards.
sentences.chinese: 他冒失地把这件事揽过去不久就后悔了。

sentences.english: Don't be rash, wear the helmet.
sentences.chinese: 别作冒失鬼，请戴安全帽。

sentences.english: Unfortunately, I made an inadvertent remark about Irma's failure while she was present.
sentences.chinese: 埃玛在场时，很不巧我冒失地提到了她的失败。

sentences.english: He is a very dangerous loose cannon .
sentences.chinese: 他是个很危险的冒失鬼。

sentences.english: Do you like The Beauty and the Bold ?
sentences.chinese: 你喜欢《美人与冒失鬼》吗？

sentences.english: His conduct has a dash of impudence in it.
Why will you tolerate that impudent fellow?
sentences.chinese: 你为什么要忍受那个冒失的家伙呢？

sentences.english: He bulled into a job that he had never done before.
sentences.chinese: 他冒冒失失地参加了一项他从未做过的工作。

sentences.english: Forget my daredevil sister practically dangling off the Cliffs of Moher.
sentences.chinese: 忘却了我那个冒失鬼妹妹几乎从莫赫山的峭壁跌落。

sentences.english: "I hear she means to get a divorce, " said Janey boldly.
sentences.chinese: “我听说她打算离婚，”詹尼冒失地说。

sentences.english: This is not just nonsense, but revoltingly insensitive.
sentences.chinese: 这不仅仅是冒失，而是令人反感的迟钝。

definition: variant of 魯莽|鲁莽[lu3 mang3]
lit. not knowing what's important (idiom); no appreciation of the gravity of things/naive/doesn't know who's who/no sense of priorities
not knowing when to come or leave (idiom); with no sense of propriety
